plugin.description: The [check_breeze](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_breeze.html) plugin reports the signal strength of a Breezecom wireless equipment.
plugin.name: breeze

vars.description: Required Name or IP address of host to check. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: breeze_hostname

vars.description: SNMPv1 community. Defaults to "public".
vars.name: breeze_community

vars.description: Required Percentage strength below which a Warning status will result. Defaults to 50.
vars.name: breeze_warning

vars.description: Required Percentage strength below which a Warning status will result. Defaults to 20.
vars.name: breeze_critical

plugin.description: The [check_by_ssh](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_by_ssh.html) plugin uses SSH to execute commands on a remote host.
plugin.examples:
$ check_by_ssh -H localhost -n lh -s c1:c2:c3 -C uptime -C uptime -C uptime -O /tmp/foo
 $ cat /tmp/foo
 [1080933700] PROCESS_SERVICE_CHECK_RESULT;flint;c1;0; up 2 days
 [1080933700] PROCESS_SERVICE_CHECK_RESULT;flint;c2;0; up 2 days
 [1080933700] PROCESS_SERVICE_CHECK_RESULT;flint;c3;0; up 2 days
plugin.name: by_ssh

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: by_ssh_address

vars.description: The SSH port. Defaults to 22.
vars.name: by_ssh_port

vars.description: Required The command that should be executed. Can be an array if multiple arguments should be passed to `check_by_ssh`.
vars.name: by_ssh_command

vars.description: A dictionary with arguments for the command. This works exactly like the 'arguments' dictionary for ordinary CheckCommands.
vars.name: by_ssh_arguments

vars.description: The SSH username.
vars.name: by_ssh_logname

vars.description: The SSH identity.
vars.name: by_ssh_identity

vars.description: Whether to suppress SSH warnings. Defaults to false.
vars.name: by_ssh_quiet

vars.description: The warning threshold.
vars.name: by_ssh_warn

vars.description: The critical threshold.
vars.name: by_ssh_crit

vars.description: The timeout in seconds.
vars.name: by_ssh_timeout

vars.description: Call ssh with '-o OPTION' (multiple options may be specified as an array).
vars.name: by_ssh_options

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: by_ssh_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: by_ssh_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_clamd](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_clamd.html) plugin tests CLAMD connections with the specified host (or unix socket).
plugin.name: clamd

vars.description: Required The host's address or unix socket (must be an absolute path).
vars.name: clamd_address

vars.description: Port number (default: none).
vars.name: clamd_port

vars.description: String to expect in server response. Multiple strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: clamd_expect

vars.description: All expect strings need to occur in server response. Defaults to false.
vars.name: clamd_all

vars.description: Enable usage of \\n, \\r, \\t or \\\\ in send string.
vars.name: clamd_escape_send

vars.description: String to send to the server.
vars.name: clamd_send

vars.description: Enable usage of \\n, \\r, \\t or \\\\ in quit string.
vars.name: clamd_escape_quit

vars.description: String to send server to initiate a clean close of the connection.
vars.name: clamd_quit

vars.description: Accept TCP refusals with states ok, warn, crit. Defaults to crit.
vars.name: clamd_refuse

vars.description: Accept expected string mismatches with states ok, warn, crit. Defaults to warn.
vars.name: clamd_mismatch

vars.description: Hide output from TCP socket.
vars.name: clamd_jail

vars.description: Close connection once more than this number of bytes are received.
vars.name: clamd_maxbytes

vars.description: Seconds to wait between sending string and polling for response.
vars.name: clamd_delay

vars.description: Minimum number of days a certificate has to be valid. 1st value is number of days for warning, 2nd is critical (if not specified: 0) -- separated by comma.
vars.name: clamd_certificate

vars.description: Use SSL for the connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: clamd_ssl

vars.description: Response time to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: clamd_wtime

vars.description: Response time to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: clamd_ctime

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out. Defaults to 10.
vars.name: clamd_timeout

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: clamd_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: clamd_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_dhcp](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_dhcp.html) plugin tests the availability of DHCP servers on a network.

vars.description: The IP address of the DHCP server which we should get a response from.
vars.name: dhcp_serverip

vars.description: The IP address which we should be offered by a DHCP server.
vars.name: dhcp_requestedip

vars.description: The timeout in seconds.
vars.name: dhcp_timeout

vars.description: The interface to use.
vars.name: dhcp_interface

vars.description: The MAC address to use in the DHCP request.
vars.name: dhcp_mac

vars.description: Whether to use unicast requests. Defaults to false.
vars.name: dhcp_unicast

plugin.description: The [check_dig](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_dig.html) plugin test the DNS service on the specified host using dig.
plugin.examples:
check_dig -H DNSSERVER -l www.example.com -A "+tcp"
 This will send a tcp query to DNSSERVER for www.example.com
plugin.name: dig

vars.description: The DNS server to query. Defaults to "127.0.0.1".
vars.name: dig_server

vars.description: Port number (default: 53).
vars.name: dig_port

vars.description: Required The address that should be looked up.
vars.name: dig_lookup

vars.description: Record type to lookup (default: A).
vars.name: dig_record_type

vars.description: An address expected to be in the answer section. If not set, uses whatever was in -l.
vars.name: dig_expected_address

vars.description: Pass STRING as argument(s) to dig.
vars.name: dig_arguments

vars.description: Number of retries passed to dig, timeout is divided by this value (Default: 3).
vars.name: dig_retries

vars.description: Response time to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: dig_warning

vars.description: Response time to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: dig_critical

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: dig_timeout

vars.description: Force dig to only use IPv4 query transport. Defaults to false.
vars.name: dig_ipv4

vars.description: Force dig to only use IPv6 query transport. Defaults to false.
vars.name: dig_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_disk](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_disk.html) plugin checks the amount of used disk space on a mounted file system and generates an alert if free space is less than one of the threshold values.
plugin.examples:
check_disk -w 10% -c 5% -p /tmp -p /var -C -w 100000 -c 50000 -p /
    Checks /tmp and /var at 10% and 5%, and / at 100MB and 50MB
 check_disk -w 100 -c 50 -C -w 1000 -c 500 -g sidDATA -r '^/oracle/SID/data.*$'
    Checks all filesystems not matching -r at 100M and 50M. The fs matching the -r regex
    are grouped which means the freespace thresholds are applied to all disks together
 check_disk -w 100 -c 50 -C -w 1000 -c 500 -p /foo -C -w 5% -c 3% -p /bar
    Checks /foo for 1000M/500M and /bar for 5/3%. All remaining volumes use 100M/50M
plugin.name: disk

vars.description: The free space warning threshold. Defaults to "20%". If the percent sign is omitted, units from `disk_units` are used.
vars.name: disk_wfree

vars.description: The free space critical threshold. Defaults to "10%". If the percent sign is omitted, units from `disk_units` are used.
vars.name: disk_cfree

vars.description: The free inode warning threshold.
vars.name: disk_inode_wfree

vars.description: The free inode critical threshold.
vars.name: disk_inode_cfree

vars.description: The partition. Deprecated in 2.3
vars.name: disk_partition

vars.description: The excluded partition. Deprecated in 2.3
vars.name: disk_partition_excluded

vars.description: The partition(s). Multiple partitions must be defined as array.
vars.name: disk_partitions

vars.description: The excluded partition(s). Multiple partitions must be defined as array.
vars.name: disk_partitions_excluded

vars.description: Clear thresholds.
vars.name: disk_clear

vars.description: For paths or partitions specified with -p, only check for exact paths.
vars.name: disk_exact_match

vars.description: Display only devices/mountpoints with errors. May be true or false.
vars.name: disk_errors_only

vars.description: If set, account root-reserved blocks are not accounted for freespace in perfdata.
vars.name: disk_ignore_reserved

vars.description: Group paths. Thresholds apply to (free-)space of all partitions together.
vars.name: disk_group

vars.description: Same as --units kB. May be true or false.
vars.name: disk_kilobytes

vars.description: Only check local filesystems. May be true or false.
vars.name: disk_local

vars.description: Only check local filesystems against thresholds. Yet call stat on remote filesystems to test if they are accessible (e.g. to detect Stale NFS Handles). May be true or false.
vars.name: disk_stat_remote_fs

vars.description: Display the mountpoint instead of the partition. May be true or false.
vars.name: disk_mountpoint

vars.description: Same as --units MB. May be true or false.
vars.name: disk_megabytes

vars.description: Explicitly select all paths. This is equivalent to -R '.\*'. May be true or false.
vars.name: disk_all

vars.description: Case insensitive regular expression for path/partition. Multiple regular expression strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: disk_eregi_path

vars.description: Regular expression for path or partition. Multiple regular expression strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: disk_ereg_path

vars.description: Regular expression to ignore selected path/partition (case insensitive). Multiple regular expression strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: disk_ignore_eregi_path

vars.description: Regular expression to ignore selected path or partition. Multiple regular expression strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: disk_ignore_ereg_path

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: disk_timeout

vars.description: Choose bytes, kB, MB, GB, TB (default: MB).
vars.name: disk_units

vars.description: Ignore all filesystems of indicated type. Multiple regular expression strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: disk_exclude_type

plugin.description: The [check_disk_smb](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_disk_smb.html) plugin uses the `smbclient` binary to check SMB shares.
plugin.name: disk_smb

vars.description: Required NetBIOS name of the server.
vars.name: disk_smb_hostname

vars.description: Required Share name being queried.
vars.name: disk_smb_share

vars.description: Workgroup or Domain used (defaults to 'WORKGROUP' if omitted).
vars.name: disk_smb_workgroup

vars.description: IP address of the host (only necessary if host belongs to another network).
vars.name: disk_smb_address

vars.description: Username for server log-in (defaults to 'guest' if omitted).
vars.name: disk_smb_username

vars.description: Password for server log-in (defaults to an empty password if omitted).
vars.name: disk_smb_password

vars.description: The used space warning threshold. Defaults to "85%". If the percent sign is omitted, use optional disk units.
vars.name: disk_smb_wused

vars.description: The used space critical threshold. Defaults to "95%". If the percent sign is omitted, use optional disk units.
vars.name: disk_smb_cused

vars.description: Connection port, e.g. `139` or `445`. Defaults to `smbclient` default if omitted.
vars.name: disk_smb_port

plugin.description: The [check_dns](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_dns.html) plugin uses the nslookup program to obtain the IP address for the given host/domain query. An optional DNS server to use may be specified. If no DNS server is specified, the default server(s) specified in `/etc/resolv.conf` will be used.

vars.description: The DNS server to query. Defaults to the server configured in the OS.

vars.description: The answer to look for. A hostname must end with a dot. Deprecated in 2.3
vars.name: dns_expected_answer

vars.description: The answer(s) to look for. A hostname must end with a dot. Multiple answers must be defined as array.
vars.name: dns_expected_answers

vars.description: Expect the server to send an authoritative answer.
vars.name: dns_authoritative

vars.description: Return warning if elapsed time exceeds value.
vars.name: dns_wtime

vars.description: Return critical if elapsed time exceeds value.
vars.name: dns_ctime

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out. Defaults to 10.
vars.name: dns_timeout

plugin.description: The [check_dummy](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_dummy.html) plugin will simply return the state corresponding to the numeric value of the `dummy_state` argument with optional text.
plugin.name: dummy

vars.description: The state. Can be one of 0 (ok), 1 (warning), 2 (critical) and 3 (unknown). Defaults to 0.
vars.name: dummy_state

vars.description: Plugin output. Defaults to "Check was successful.".
vars.name: dummy_text

vars.description: File must be no more than this many seconds old as critical threshold. Defaults to "600s".

vars.description: File must be at least this many bytes long as warning threshold. No default given.

vars.description: File must be at least this many bytes long as critical threshold. Defaults to "0B".
vars.name: file_age_critical_size

vars.description: Return OK if the file does not exist. Defaults to false.
vars.name: file_age_ignoremissing

plugin.description: The [check_game](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_game.html) plugin tests game server connections with the specified host. This plugin uses the 'qstat' command, the popular game server status query tool. If you don't have the package installed, you will need to [download](http://www.activesw.com/people/steve/qstat.html) or install the package `quakestat` before you can use this plugin.
plugin.name: game

vars.description: Required Ipaddress of the game server to query.
vars.name: game_ipaddress

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out. Defaults to 10.
vars.name: game_timeout

vars.description: Port to connect to.
vars.name: game_port

vars.description: Field number in raw qstat output that contains game name.
vars.name: game_gamefield

vars.description: Field number in raw qstat output that contains map name.
vars.name: game_mapfield

vars.description: Field number in raw qstat output that contains ping time.
vars.name: game_pingfield

vars.description: Field number in raw qstat output that contains game time.
vars.name: game_gametime

vars.description: Name of the host running the game.
vars.name: game_hostname

plugin.description: The [check_hpjd](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_hpjd.html) plugin tests the state of an HP printer with a JetDirect card. Net-snmp must be installed on the computer running the plugin.
plugin.name: hpjd

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: hpjd_address

vars.description: The host's SNMP port. Defaults to 161.
vars.name: hpjd_port

vars.description: The SNMP community. Defaults  to "public".
vars.name: hpjd_community

plugin.description: The [check_http](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_http.html) plugin tests the HTTP service on the specified host. It can test normal (http) and secure (https) servers, follow redirects, search for strings and regular expressions, check connection times, and report on certificate expiration times.
plugin.examples:
CHECK CONTENT: check_http -w 5 -c 10 --ssl -H www.verisign.com

 When the 'www.verisign.com' server returns its content within 5 seconds,
 a STATE_OK will be returned. When the server returns its content but exceeds
 the 5-second threshold, a STATE_Warning will be returned. When an error occurs,
 a STATE_Critical will be returned.

 CHECK CERTIFICATE: check_http -H www.verisign.com -C 14

 When the certificate of 'www.verisign.com' is valid for more than 14 days,
 a STATE_OK is returned. When the certificate is still valid, but for less than
 14 days, a STATE_Warning is returned. A STATE_Critical will be returned when
 the certificate is expired.

 CHECK CERTIFICATE: check_http -H www.verisign.com -C 30,14

 When the certificate of 'www.verisign.com' is valid for more than 30 days,
 a STATE_OK is returned. When the certificate is still valid, but for less than
 30 days, but more than 14 days, a STATE_Warning is returned.
 A STATE_Critical will be returned when certificate expires in less than 14 days
 CHECK SSL WEBSERVER CONTENT VIA PROXY USING HTTP 1.1 CONNECT:

 check_http -I 192.168.100.35 -p 80 -u https://www.verisign.com/ -S -j CONNECT -H www.verisign.com 
 all these options are needed: -I <proxy> -p <proxy-port> -u <check-url> -S(sl) -j CONNECT -H <webserver>
 a STATE_OK will be returned. When the server returns its content but exceeds
 the 5-second threshold, a STATE_Warning will be returned. When an error occurs,
 a STATE_Critical will be returned.
plugin.name: http

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: http_address

vars.description: The virtual host that should be sent in the "Host" header.
vars.name: http_vhost

vars.description: The request URI for GET or POST. Defaults to `/`.
vars.name: http_uri

vars.description: The TCP port. Defaults to 80 when not using SSL, 443 otherwise.
vars.name: http_port

vars.description: Whether to use SSL. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_ssl

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.1.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_1

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.2.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_2

vars.description: Whether to force SSLv2.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_sslv2

vars.description: Whether to force SSLv3.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_sslv3

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.1 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_1_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.2 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_2_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to force SSLv2 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_sslv2_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to force SSLv3 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_sslv3_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to use SNI. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_sni

vars.description: Add 'username:password' authorization pair.
vars.name: http_auth_pair

vars.description: Add 'username:password' authorization pair for proxy.
vars.name: http_proxy_auth_pair

vars.description: Don't download the body, just the headers.
vars.name: http_ignore_body

vars.description: Allow regex to span newline.
vars.name: http_linespan

vars.description: A regular expression which the body must match against. Incompatible with http_ignore_body.
vars.name: http_expect_body_regex

vars.description: A case-insensitive expression which the body must match against. Incompatible with http_ignore_body.
vars.name: http_expect_body_eregi

vars.description: Changes behaviour of http_expect_body_regex and http_expect_body_eregi to return Critical if found, OK if not.
vars.name: http_invertregex

vars.description: The warning threshold.
vars.name: http_warn_time

vars.description: The critical threshold.
vars.name: http_critical_time

vars.description: Comma-delimited list of strings, at least one of them is expected in the first (status) line of the server response. Default: HTTP/1.
vars.name: http_expect

vars.description: Minimum number of days a certificate has to be valid. This parameter explicitely sets the port to 443 and ignores the URL if passed.
vars.name: http_certificate

vars.description: Name of file contains the client certificate (PEM format).
vars.name: http_clientcert

vars.description: Name of file contains the private key (PEM format).
vars.name: http_privatekey

vars.description: String to expect in the response headers.
vars.name: http_headerstring

vars.description: String to expect in the content.
vars.name: http_string

vars.description: URL encoded http POST data.
vars.name: http_post

vars.description: Set http method (for example: HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, PUT, DELETE).
vars.name: http_method

vars.description: Warn if document is more than seconds old.
vars.name: http_maxage

vars.description: Specify Content-Type header when POSTing.
vars.name: http_contenttype

vars.description: String to be sent in http header as User Agent.
vars.name: http_useragent

vars.description: Any other tags to be sent in http header.
vars.name: http_header

vars.description: Print additional perfdata. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_extendedperfdata

vars.description: How to handle redirect pages. Possible values: "ok" (default), "warning", "critical", "follow", "sticky" (like follow but stick to address), "stickyport" (like sticky but also to port)
vars.name: http_onredirect

vars.description: Minimum page size required:Maximum page size required.
vars.name: http_pagesize

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out.
vars.name: http_timeout

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_icmp](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_icmp.html) plugin check_icmp allows for checking multiple hosts at once compared to `check_ping`. The main difference is that check_ping executes the system's ping(1) command and parses its output while check_icmp talks ICMP itself. check_icmp must be installed setuid root.
plugin.name: icmp

vars.description: The host's address. This can either be a single address or an array of addresses. Defaults to "$address$".
vars.name: icmp_address

vars.description: The RTA warning threshold in milliseconds. Defaults to 100.
vars.name: icmp_wrta

vars.description: The packet loss warning threshold in %. Defaults to 5.
vars.name: icmp_wpl

vars.description: The RTA critical threshold in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
vars.name: icmp_crta

vars.description: The packet loss critical threshold in %. Defaults to 15.
vars.name: icmp_cpl

vars.description: The source IP address to send packets from.
vars.name: icmp_source

vars.description: The number of packets to send. Defaults to 5.
vars.name: icmp_packets

vars.description: The maximum packet interval. Defaults to 80 (milliseconds).
vars.name: icmp_packet_interval

vars.description: The maximum target interval.
vars.name: icmp_target_interval

vars.description: The number of hosts which have to be alive for the check to succeed.
vars.name: icmp_hosts_alive

vars.description: Payload size for each ICMP request. Defaults to 8.
vars.name: icmp_data_bytes

vars.description: The plugin timeout in seconds. Defaults to 10 (seconds).
vars.name: icmp_timeout

plugin.description: The [check_imap](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_imap.html) plugin tests IMAP connections with the specified host (or unix socket).
plugin.name: imap

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: imap_address

vars.description: The port that should be checked. Defaults to 143.
vars.name: imap_port

vars.description: Can use \\n, \\r, \\t or \\ in send or quit string. Must come before send or quit option. Default: nothing added to send, \\r\\n added to end of quit.
vars.name: imap_escape

vars.description: String to send to the server.
vars.name: imap_send

vars.description: String to expect in server response. Multiple strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: imap_expect

vars.description: All expect strings need to occur in server response. Default is any.
vars.name: imap_all

vars.description: String to send server to initiate a clean close of the connection.
vars.name: imap_quit

vars.description: Accept TCP refusals with states ok, warn, crit (default: crit).
vars.name: imap_refuse

vars.description: Accept expected string mismatches with states ok, warn, crit (default: warn).
vars.name: imap_mismatch

vars.description: Hide output from TCP socket.
vars.name: imap_jail

vars.description: Close connection once more than this number of bytes are received.
vars.name: imap_maxbytes

vars.description: Seconds to wait between sending string and polling for response.
vars.name: imap_delay

vars.description: Minimum number of days a certificate has to be valid.
vars.name: imap_certificate_age

vars.description: Use SSL for the connection.
vars.name: imap_ssl

vars.description: Response time to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: imap_warning

vars.description: Response time to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: imap_critical

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: imap_timeout

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: imap_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: imap_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_ldap](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_ldap.html) plugin can be used to check LDAP servers.
plugin.name: ldap

vars.description: Host name, IP Address, or unix socket (must be an absolute path). Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: ldap_address

vars.description: Port number. Defaults to 389.
vars.name: ldap_port

vars.description: LDAP attribute to search for (default: "(objectclass=*)"
vars.name: ldap_attr

vars.description: Required LDAP base (eg. ou=myunit,o=myorg,c=at).
vars.name: ldap_base

vars.description: LDAP bind DN (if required).
vars.name: ldap_bind

vars.description: LDAP password (if required).
vars.name: ldap_pass

vars.description: Use STARTSSL mechanism introduced in protocol version 3.
vars.name: ldap_starttls

vars.description: Use LDAPS (LDAP v2 SSL method). This also sets the default port to 636.
vars.name: ldap_ssl

vars.description: Use LDAP protocol version 2 (enabled by default).
vars.name: ldap_v2

vars.description: Use LDAP protocol version 3 (disabled by default)
vars.name: ldap_v3

vars.description: Response time to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: ldap_warning

vars.description: Response time to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: ldap_critical

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: ldap_timeout

vars.description: Show details for command-line debugging (disabled by default)
vars.name: ldap_verbose

plugin.description: The [check_load](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_load.html) plugin tests the current system load average.
plugin.name: load

vars.description: The 1-minute warning threshold. Defaults to 5.
vars.name: load_wload1

vars.description: The 5-minute warning threshold. Defaults to 4.
vars.name: load_wload5

vars.description: The 15-minute warning threshold. Defaults to 3.
vars.name: load_wload15

vars.description: The 1-minute critical threshold. Defaults to 10.
vars.name: load_cload1

vars.description: The 5-minute critical threshold. Defaults to 6.
vars.name: load_cload5

vars.description: The 15-minute critical threshold. Defaults to 4.
vars.name: load_cload15

vars.description: Divide the load averages by the number of CPUs (when possible). Defaults to false.
vars.name: load_percpu

plugin.description: The [check_mailq](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_mailq.html) plugin checks the number of messages in the mail queue (supports multiple sendmail queues, qmail).
plugin.name: mailq

vars.description: Required Min. number of messages in queue to generate warning.
vars.name: mailq_warning

vars.description: Required Min. number of messages in queue to generate critical alert ( w < c ).
vars.name: mailq_critical

vars.description: Min. number of messages for same domain in queue to generate warning
vars.name: mailq_domain_warning

vars.description: Min. number of messages for same domain in queue to generate critical alert ( W < C ).
vars.name: mailq_domain_critical

vars.description: Plugin timeout in seconds (default = 15).
vars.name: mailq_timeout

plugin.description: The [check_mysql](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_mysql.html) plugin tests connections to a MySQL server.
plugin.name: mysql

vars.description: Host name, IP Address, or unix socket (must be an absolute path).
vars.name: mysql_hostname

vars.description: Port number (default: 3306).
vars.name: mysql_port

vars.description: Ignore authentication failure and check for mysql connectivity only.
vars.name: mysql_ignore_auth

vars.description: Check database with indicated name.
vars.name: mysql_database

vars.description: Read from the specified client options file.

vars.name: mysql_group

vars.name: mysql_username

vars.description: Check if the slave thread is running properly.
vars.name: mysql_check_slave

vars.description: Exit with Warning status if slave server is more than INTEGER seconds behind master.
vars.name: mysql_warning

vars.description: Exit with Critical status if slave server is more then INTEGER seconds behind master.
vars.name: mysql_critical

vars.description: Use ssl encryptation.
vars.name: mysql_ssl

vars.description: Path to CA signing the cert.
vars.name: mysql_cacert

vars.description: Path to SSL certificate.
vars.name: mysql_cert

vars.description: Path to private SSL key.
vars.name: mysql_key

vars.description: Path to CA directory.
vars.name: mysql_cadir

vars.description: List of valid SSL ciphers.
vars.name: mysql_ciphers

plugin.description: The [check_mysql_query](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_mysql_query.html) plugin checks a query result against threshold levels. The result from the query should be numeric. For extra security, create a user with minimal access.
plugin.name: mysql_query

vars.description: Host name, IP Address, or unix socket (must be an absolute path).
vars.name: mysql_query_hostname

vars.description: Port number (default: 3306).
vars.name: mysql_query_port

vars.description: Check database with indicated name.
vars.name: mysql_query_database

vars.description: Read from the specified client options file.
vars.name: mysql_query_file

vars.description: Use a client options group.
vars.name: mysql_query_group

vars.description: Connect using the indicated username.
vars.name: mysql_query_username

vars.description: Use the indicated password to authenticate the connection.
vars.name: mysql_query_password

vars.description: Required SQL Query to run on the MySQL Server.
vars.name: mysql_query_execute

vars.description: Exit with Warning status if query is outside of the range (format: start:end).
vars.name: mysql_query_warning

vars.description: Exit with Critical status if query is outside of the range.
vars.name: mysql_query_critical

plugin.description: The [check_ntp_time](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_ntp_time.html) plugin checks the clock offset between the local host and a remote NTP server.
plugin.name: ntp_time

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: ntp_address

vars.description: Port number (default: 123).
vars.name: ntp_port

vars.description: Returns Unknown instead of Critical if offset cannot be found.
vars.name: ntp_quiet

vars.description: Offset to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: ntp_warning

vars.description: Offset to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: ntp_critical

vars.description: Expected offset of the ntp server relative to local server (seconds).
vars.name: ntp_timeoffset

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: ntp_timeout

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: ntp_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: ntp_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_ntp_peer](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_ntp_peer.html) plugin checks the health of an NTP server. It supports checking the offset with the sync peer, the jitter and stratum. This plugin will not check the clock offset between the local host and NTP  server; please use `ntp_time` for that purpose.
plugin.examples:
Simple NTP server check:
  ./check_ntp_peer -H ntpserv -w 0.5 -c 1

 Check jitter too, avoiding critical notifications if jitter isn't available
 (See Notes above for more details on thresholds formats):
  ./check_ntp_peer -H ntpserv -w 0.5 -c 1 -j -1:100 -k -1:200

 Only check the number of usable time sources ("truechimers"):
  ./check_ntp_peer -H ntpserv -m @5 -n @3

 Check only stratum:
  ./check_ntp_peer -H ntpserv -W 4 -C 6
plugin.name: ntp_peer

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: ntp_address

vars.description: The port to use. Default to 123.
vars.name: ntp_port

vars.description: Offset to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: ntp_warning

vars.description: Offset to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: ntp_critical

vars.description: Warning threshold for stratum of server's synchronization peer.
vars.name: ntp_wstratum

vars.description: Critical threshold for stratum of server's synchronization peer.
vars.name: ntp_cstratum

vars.description: Warning threshold for jitter.
vars.name: ntp_wjitter

vars.description: Critical threshold for jitter.
vars.name: ntp_cjitter

vars.description: Warning threshold for number of usable time sources.
vars.name: ntp_wsource

vars.description: Critical threshold for number of usable time sources.
vars.name: ntp_csource

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: ntp_timeout

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: ntp_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: ntp_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_pgsql](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_pgsql.html) plugin tests a PostgreSQL DBMS to determine whether it is active and accepting queries. If a query is specified using the `pgsql_query` attribute, it will be executed after connecting to the server. The result from the query has to be numeric in order to compare it against the query thresholds if set.
plugin.name: pgsql

vars.description: Host name, IP Address, or unix socket (must be an absolute path).
vars.name: pgsql_hostname

vars.description: Port number (default: 5432).
vars.name: pgsql_port

vars.description: Database to check (default: template1).
vars.name: pgsql_database

vars.description: Login name of user.
vars.name: pgsql_username

vars.description: Password (BIG SECURITY ISSUE).
vars.name: pgsql_password

vars.description: Connection parameters (keyword = value), see below.
vars.name: pgsql_options

vars.description: Response time to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: pgsql_warning

vars.description: Response time to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: pgsql_critical

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: pgsql_timeout

vars.description: SQL query to run. Only first column in first row will be read.
vars.name: pgsql_query

vars.description: SQL query value to result in warning status (double).
vars.name: pgsql_query_warning

vars.description: SQL query value to result in critical status (double).
vars.name: pgsql_query_critical

plugin.description: The [check_ping](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_ping.html) plugin uses the ping command to probe the specified host for packet loss (percentage) and round trip average (milliseconds).
plugin.name: ping

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: ping_address

vars.description: The RTA warning threshold in milliseconds. Defaults to 100.
vars.name: ping_wrta

vars.description: The packet loss warning threshold in %. Defaults to 5.
vars.name: ping_wpl

vars.description: The RTA critical threshold in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
vars.name: ping_crta

vars.description: The packet loss critical threshold in %. Defaults to 15.
vars.name: ping_cpl

vars.description: The number of packets to send. Defaults to 5.
vars.name: ping_packets

vars.description: The plugin timeout in seconds. Defaults to 0 (no timeout).
vars.name: ping_timeout

plugin.description: The [check_procs](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_procs.html) plugin checks all processes and generates Warning or Critical states if the specified metric is outside the required threshold ranges. The metric defaults to number of processes. Search filters can be applied to limit the processes to check.
plugin.examples:
check_procs -w 2:2 -c 2:1024 -C portsentry
  Warning if not two processes with command name portsentry.
  Critical if < 2 or > 1024 processes

 check_procs -w 10 -a '/usr/local/bin/perl' -u root
  Warning alert if > 10 processes with command arguments containing
  '/usr/local/bin/perl' and owned by root

 check_procs -w 50000 -c 100000 --metric=VSZ
  Alert if VSZ of any processes over 50K or 100K

 check_procs -w 10 -c 20 --metric=CPU
  Alert if CPU of any processes over 10%% or 20%%
plugin.name: procs

vars.description: The process count warning threshold. Defaults to 250.
vars.name: procs_warning

vars.description: The process count critical threshold. Defaults to 400.
vars.name: procs_critical

vars.description: Check thresholds against metric.
vars.name: procs_metric

vars.description: Seconds before plugin times out.
vars.name: procs_timeout

vars.description: Filter own process the traditional way by PID instead of /proc/pid/exe. Defaults to false.
vars.name: procs_traditional

vars.description: Only scan for processes that have one or more of the status flags you specify.
vars.name: procs_state

vars.description: Only scan for children of the parent process ID indicated.
vars.name: procs_ppid

vars.description: Only scan for processes with VSZ higher than indicated.
vars.name: procs_vsz

vars.description: Only scan for processes with RSS higher than indicated.
vars.name: procs_rss

vars.description: Only scan for processes with PCPU higher than indicated.
vars.name: procs_pcpu

vars.description: Only scan for processes with user name or ID indicated.
vars.name: procs_user

vars.description: Only scan for processes with args that contain STRING.
vars.name: procs_argument

vars.description: Only scan for processes with args that contain the regex STRING.
vars.name: procs_argument_regex

vars.description: Only scan for exact matches of COMMAND (without path).
vars.name: procs_command

vars.description: Only scan for non kernel threads. Defaults to false.
vars.name: procs_nokthreads

vars.description: The port that should be checked. Defaults to 465.
vars.name: ssmtp_port

vars.description: Can use \\n, \\r, \\t or \\ in send or quit string. Must come before send or quit option. Default: nothing added to send, \\r\\n added to end of quit.
vars.name: ssmtp_escape

vars.description: String to send to the server.
vars.name: ssmtp_send

vars.description: String to expect in server response. Multiple strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: ssmtp_expect

vars.description: All expect strings need to occur in server response. Default is any.
vars.name: ssmtp_all

vars.description: String to send server to initiate a clean close of the connection.
vars.name: ssmtp_quit

vars.description: Accept TCP refusals with states ok, warn, crit (default: crit).
vars.name: ssmtp_refuse

vars.description: Accept expected string mismatches with states ok, warn, crit (default: warn).
vars.name: ssmtp_mismatch

vars.description: Hide output from TCP socket.
vars.name: ssmtp_jail

vars.description: Close connection once more than this number of bytes are received.
vars.name: ssmtp_maxbytes

vars.description: Seconds to wait between sending string and polling for response.
vars.name: ssmtp_delay

vars.description: Minimum number of days a certificate has to be valid.
vars.name: ssmtp_certificate_age

vars.description: Use SSL for the connection.
vars.name: ssmtp_ssl

vars.description: Response time to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: ssmtp_warning

vars.description: Response time to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: ssmtp_critical

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: ssmtp_timeout

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: ssmtp_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: ssmtp_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_swap](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_swap.html) plugin checks the swap space on a local machine.
plugin.name: swap

vars.description: The free swap space warning threshold in % (enable `swap_integer` for number values). Defaults to `50%`.
vars.name: swap_wfree

vars.description: The free swap space critical threshold in % (enable `swap_integer` for number values). Defaults to `25%`.
vars.name: swap_cfree

vars.description: Specifies whether the thresholds are passed as number or percent value. Defaults to false (percent values).
vars.name: swap_integer

vars.description: Conduct comparisons for all swap partitions, one by one. Defaults to false.
vars.name: swap_allswaps

vars.description: Resulting state when there is no swap regardless of thresholds. Possible values are "ok", "warning", "critical", "unknown". Defaults to "critical".
vars.name: swap_noswap

plugin.description: The [check_tcp](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_tcp.html) plugin tests TCP connections with the specified host (or unix socket).
plugin.name: tcp

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: tcp_address

vars.description: Required The port that should be checked.
vars.name: tcp_port

vars.description: String to expect in server response. Multiple strings must be defined as array.
vars.name: tcp_expect

vars.description: All expect strings need to occur in server response. Defaults to false.
vars.name: tcp_all

vars.description: Enable usage of \\n, \\r, \\t or \\\\ in send string.
vars.name: tcp_escape_send

vars.description: String to send to the server.
vars.name: tcp_send

vars.description: Enable usage of \\n, \\r, \\t or \\\\ in quit string.
vars.name: tcp_escape_quit

vars.description: String to send server to initiate a clean close of the connection.
vars.name: tcp_quit

vars.description: Accept TCP refusals with states ok, warn, crit. Defaults to crit.
vars.name: tcp_refuse

vars.description: Accept expected string mismatches with states ok, warn, crit. Defaults to warn.
vars.name: tcp_mismatch

vars.description: Hide output from TCP socket.
vars.name: tcp_jail

vars.description: Close connection once more than this number of bytes are received.
vars.name: tcp_maxbytes

vars.description: Seconds to wait between sending string and polling for response.
vars.name: tcp_delay

vars.description: Minimum number of days a certificate has to be valid. 1st value is number of days for warning, 2nd is critical (if not specified: 0) -- separated by comma.
vars.name: tcp_certificate

vars.description: Use SSL for the connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: tcp_ssl

vars.description: Response time to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: tcp_wtime

vars.description: Response time to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: tcp_ctime

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out. Defaults to 10.
vars.name: tcp_timeout

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: tcp_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: tcp_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_udp](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_udp.html) plugin tests UDP connections with the specified host (or unix socket).
plugin.name: udp

vars.description: The host's address. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: udp_address

vars.description: Required The port that should be checked.
vars.name: udp_port

vars.description: Required The payload to send in the UDP datagram.
vars.name: udp_send

vars.description: Required The payload to expect in the response datagram.
vars.name: udp_expect

vars.description: The payload to send to 'close' the session.
vars.name: udp_quit

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: udp_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: udp_ipv6

plugin.description: The [check_ups](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_ups.html) plugin tests the UPS service on the specified host. [Network UPS Tools](http://www.networkupstools.org)  must be running for this plugin to work.
plugin.name: ups

vars.description: Required The address of the host running upsd. Defaults to "$address$" if the host's `address` attribute is set, "$address6$" otherwise.
vars.name: ups_address

vars.description: Required The UPS name. Defaults to `ups`.
vars.name: ups_name

vars.description: The port to which to connect. Defaults to 3493.
vars.name: ups_port

vars.description: The variable to monitor. Must be one of LINE, TEMP, BATTPCT or LOADPCT. If this is not set, the check only relies on the value of `ups.status`.
vars.name: ups_variable

vars.description: The warning threshold for the selected variable.
vars.name: ups_warning

vars.description: The critical threshold for the selected variable.
vars.name: ups_critical

vars.description: Display the temperature in degrees Celsius instead of Fahrenheit. Defaults to `false`.
vars.name: ups_celsius

vars.description: The number of seconds before the connection times out. Defaults to 10.
vars.name: ups_timeout

plugin.description: The [check_users](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_users.html) plugin checks the number of users currently logged in on the local system and generates an error if the number exceeds the thresholds specified.
plugin.name: users

vars.description: The user count warning threshold. Defaults to 20.
vars.name: users_wgreater

vars.description: The user count critical threshold. Defaults to 50.
vars.name: users_cgreater
